title: Notting Hill Carnival: 'We're playing in Brixton this year'
description: Channel One have been at every Notting Hill Carnival since 1983 but this year the event is online.

title: Why are clothing sizes so erratic and can they be fixed?
description: New apps use your phone to record your dimensions and recommend what size to buy at shops.

title: The Little Princess Trust: 'Do you miss having long hair?'
description: Two girls who have been involved with a charity that uses donated hair talk of their experiences.

title: Music ban 'kiss of death for restaurant ambience'
description: Restaurateurs and hoteliers in Scotland are calling for a ban on background music to be lifted.

title: ‘Black people have been through a lot this year’
description: How the combination of lockdown and all the events surrounding Black Lives Matter have affected the mental health of African Americans.

title: England v Pakistan: James Anderson takes 599th Test wicket - highlights
description: England's James Anderson takes his 599th Test wicket but bad weather frustrates England's push for victory against Pakistan on day four of the third Test in Southampton.

title: Cars filmed on A10 near Cambridge speeding and crashing into each other
description: Video posted on social media shows three cars repeatedly colliding before being abandoned.

title: Coronavirus: What can we learn from schools that have reopened?
description: Coronavirus evacuations and back-to-school nerves - how have some found it?

title: Coronavirus: Scottish high schools to introduce new face covering rules
description: Ministers are consulting on the use of face coverings in corridors and communal areas in Scotland's secondaries.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson says it is 'vitally important' children return to class
description: Boris Johnson tries to reassure parents that schools are Covid-secure, ahead of term starting.

title: Bletchley Park: New crisis for code-breaking hub
description: The chief executive of the Bletchley Park Trust says it is struggling to survive.

title: US allows emergency use of blood plasma treatment for coronavirus patients
description: The move comes after Donald Trump accused regulators of impeding the development of a Covid-19 cure.

title: Coronavirus: Teens' anxiety levels dropped during pandemic, study finds
description: Researchers found pupils aged 13 and 14 were less anxious during lockdown compared to last year.

title: IPC wheelchair basketball decision 'violates athlete rights'
description: The IPC's decision to declare some wheelchair basketball players ineligible for the Tokyo Paralympics "grossly violates athletes’ rights", says Global Athlete.

title: Who can stop Exeter, why Edinburgh caught the eye and who should coach the Lions?
description: BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones on who can stop the Chiefs, the start of the Pro14 and Scott Robertson's Lions link.

title: Israeli youths unearth 1,100-year-old gold coins from Abbasid era
description: Volunteers at an archaeological dig find 425 coins, enough to buy a mansion when they were buried.

title: H-ABC: Mothers raising awareness of rare disease
description: Three mothers are raising awareness of H-ABC, believed to be one of the rarest diseases on the planet.

title: Mike Ashley buys long-time rival's business out of administration
description: The Sports Direct owner will buy Dave Whelan's gyms and fitness assets after they went bust.

title: Kenosha shooting: Protests erupt after US police shoot black man
description: An overnight curfew is imposed on the US state's Kenosha county, after the man is seriously injured.

title: BTS's Dynamite shatters YouTube records - and heads for UK number one
description: Dynamite is the first video in YouTube history to gain over 100 million views in a 24-hour period.

title: Fortnite Apple row: Microsoft backs Epic in court filing
description: The Xbox company has declared support for the Fortnite-maker as it battles Apple's "monopoly".

title: Kellyanne Conway resigns as senior White House adviser
description: Mrs Conway is stepping down at the end of August to give her children "less drama, more mama".

title: Christchurch shooting: Gunman Tarrant wanted to kill 'as many as possible'
description: A sentencing hearing begins for the man behind the worst mass shooting in modern New Zealand's history.

title: Newspaper headlines: PM's plea to parents and UK's 'raving idiots'
description: The prime minister's appeal to parents to send their children back to school leads many of Monday's papers.

title: Sea swimming is 'amazing' for mental health and menopause
description: Swimming in the sea is showing benefits for mental as well as physical health.

title: RNC 2020: Speakers and schedule for Trump's Republican Party convention
description: The Republican Party is now the president's party - he will speak every night and so will his family.
